A Founder's Guide to Writing More

stories.text:
Often billionaires, CEOs and other wealthy people such as Elon Musk brag about how much they are working.
I don't think that how "hard" they work really matters at all to the company, it is how hard their employees work that does matter.
Bezos would not be where he is right now if he hadn't 100 thousands and people working under extreme conditions in Amazon warehouses.
The work hard to get successful is a mirage invented by CEOs and company founders to have their employees work hard for them so that they can profit from the hard labor of their employees.
You can work as hard and as much as you can flipping steaks at a fast food restaurant work and still not afford a decent healthcare.
stories.title: You become a $1B by letting people work hard for you, not by working hard
